intro: Eleocharis tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Eleocharis tucumanensis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for aquatic life.
